author: Angus Gow
title: Insurance Claims Processing
description: Insurance fraud costs the UK around £1.3bn, applying dApps and tokenisation to the insurance process this could be greatly reduced.

assessments.note: This idea is in twice. No detail on what is being developed and how honesty would be assessed.

The proposal appears to align with the challenge. The reason why it is getting a low mark is because there is not enough information about how it will measure success or how it's dApp will drive adoption of Cardano. The proposal would be strengthened by better articulating it's value added to the ecosystem. What I am missing is the justification why the solution proposed is best suited to address existing problems. Other than insurance being publicly subsidized, which causes inequalities, it is unclear which other problems this aims to address.
Bringing insurance to Cardano is a great idea. It is true that insurance fraud is a huge problem which has to be solved. Having insurance on Cardano would definetly benefit our ecosystem.
The tokenization of insurance is no doubt a great use case for blockchain.  The proposal in its current state does not convince me that the team can accomplish this.

it is important that more details are described about the problem, because in order for us to measure the impact of a proposal it is necessary to understand the size of the problem. Why would blockchains help reduce insurance costs? What is the potential for cost savings? The plan is still a draft and has few details.

**The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.

(This is a duplicate of another proposal by the same team with some added info in the attachment) Building an insurance dApp on the Cardano ecosystem for registering claims and paying the claims could have a potential of utility increase and wider adoption. Since the app is already being build by developers, it would have been very useful to have some more details regarding how the app is running in order to be able to determine how effectively it addresses the challenge.
Please provide a detailed plan with milestones. How will you asses honesty? Why is an honesty token worth more than the large payout for dishonesty under an insurance contract?

There is simply not enough information to make this determination. The proposers provide little to no details on why they are suited to conduct this work. There is no overview of the existing team, and there is no action plan provided with measurable milestones to indicate success. This will leave significant gaps in understanding for voters as to whether the team can actually deliver.

The proposer claims to have decades of system dev. experience. But there is no way to verify this. If a team asks for 150k I think its ok to expect and introduction of the team.  In this proposal there is only a website linked which hasn't that much information about details as well. There is no explanation on how exactly the 150k are allocated.
The proposal does not include a detailed road map.  The brief proposal makes me doubt the author's commitment to what appears and ambitious project.

**The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.

The plan is still a draft. There are no details on how the proposal will prevent fraud. There is little information about the team, I recommend providing details about how many people will be part of the proposal and details about the experience and qualifications of each one, also indicating what will be their role in the proposal. It is important to detail the budget allocation better. If the budget is used in its entirety to pay developers, I recommend detailing the work to be performed by the devs and an estimate of hours for the work to be performed.

I also recommend that the team follow the Catalyst documentation as a reference to prepare a proposal.
The extra information in the attachment offers a bit of an insight into the general idea of the app, though it doesn't go into enough details to help better assess its implementation.
More details on technical and economic model. What is the sales channel to get the product accepted even if it is developed? Where is the budget justifying $150,000 funding request?

There is insufficient information to determine how feasible the proposal is and how effectively it would meet the challenge criteria. 

To increase the score of the proposal there should be a discussion about foreseen challenges and any potential work arounds that have been identified. 
In addition, the proposal is requesting a budget of $150,000 yet there is no breakdown of the request. It is unclear how many people will be needed to develop this project, what tools are already available and what is still needed. 
Given that there are no timelines presented within the proposal it is unclear how long this project would take. What is the work flow and process? What steps will the proposers take to share successes and failures to the voters?

There is no roadmap or milestones defined. The definition of succes is unclear as well. The proposal is really short which makes it quite hard to asses. I'm sure there are other projects that try to make insurance work on cardano so maybe a risk assessment would have been great.

No specific goals or breakdown of funds have been given, and the amount requested is very large.  There is no real way to audit the work. I worry that the funds would not be used in a way that adds value to the ecosystem.

Some information about the team has been described, but other than that, there is no information to audit the proposal. I recommend that the team read the Catalyst documentation and adapt the proposal, including metrics, roadmap, KPIs and the other items present in the documentation.

**The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.

The milestones and budget presented are only for the implementation on the Cardano blockchain, since the app is already being developed by a different team of developers as specified by the proposer in a comment "We are already funded for our insurance and app business so are not reliant on funding via catalyst […] The funding would be used to employ 2 full-time developers dedicated to this work. There are other developers in the team to support and infrastructure already in place."
In this case, it would have been useful to have more details regarding this specific part that they are asking the funds for, in order to have a better understanding of the progress.

solution: Claims data is written to the ledger and the process between the parties is automated, tokens reward honesty, honest actors are rated.
experience: We develop insurance apps (kudoinsurance.com), one of the team operates a Cardano stake pool. We have decades of systems dev experience.
